user.title: Choose OIDC Provider
user.description:
Select your OpenID Connect identity provider to get started with the setup.

If you want to use a provider that isn't listed, try the Generic OpenID Connect provider or use the advanced YAML configuration instead.

discovery_url.title: Provider Configuration
discovery_url.description:
Enter the discovery URL for {provider_name}. This is typically found in your provider's admin interface and ends with '/.well-known/openid-configuration'.

Need detailed setup instructions? See the [provider guide]({documentation_url}).

validate_connection.title: Connection Validation
validate_connection.description:
Testing connection to your {provider_name} OIDC provider...

**Discovery URL:** {discovery_url}

{discovery_details}

**What to do next:**
- **Continue Setup:** Proceed with the configuration (when validation succeeds)
- **Retry Validation:** Test the connection again with current settings
- **Modify Discovery URL:** Go back to change the discovery URL
- **Change Provider:** Start over with a different provider

**Need Help?** Check the [setup documentation]({documentation_url}) for detailed configuration instructions.

client_config.title: Client Configuration
client_config.description:
Configure your OIDC client. You can find these details in your {provider_name} application settings.

**Discovery URL:** {discovery_url}

**Setup Instructions:**
1. Register a new application in your OIDC provider
2. Set the application type to 'Public Client' (recommended for most users)
3. Add redirect URLs for Home Assistant
4. Copy the Client ID below

**Note:** If your provider requires a client secret, check 'Use Confidential Client' and provide your client secret below.

**Need detailed setup instructions?** Check the [setup guide]({documentation_url}) for step-by-step instructions.

data.client_secret: Client Secret (optional; required by some providers)

groups_config.title: Groups & Role Configuration
groups_config.description:
Configure how user groups from {provider_name} should be mapped to Home Assistant roles.

**Groups Support:** Groups allow you to automatically assign admin or user roles based on group membership in your identity provider.

**Admin Group:** Users in this group will have administrator access
**User Group:** Users in this group will have standard user access (leave empty to allow all authenticated users)

user_linking.title: User Linking Options
user_linking.description:
Configure how OIDC users are linked to existing Home Assistant users.

**⚠️ Important Security Information:**

**User Linking Disabled (Recommended):** New OIDC accounts are created for each user. This is the most secure option.

**User Linking Enabled:** OIDC users can be linked to existing Home Assistant users by username. **This has security implications:**
- If someone can guess or obtain a Home Assistant username, they might gain access to that account
- Only enable this if you're migrating from local Home Assistant accounts to OIDC
- You can disable this later if needed

data.enable_user_linking: Enable automatic user linking (⚠️ Security Risk)

finalize.title: Setup Complete
finalize.description:
Your OIDC authentication is now configured and ready to use.

**Next Steps:**
1. Save this configuration
2. Restart Home Assistant if prompted
3. The OIDC login option will appear on your login screen

**Advanced Configuration:**
Advanced options like custom networking settings, specific claim configurations, or custom scopes are only available through YAML configuration. See the documentation for details.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure OIDC Authentication
reconfigure.description:
Update your OIDC client credentials for {provider_name}.

**Discovery URL:** {discovery_url}

**What you can change:**
- **Client ID**: Update your application's client identifier
- **Client Type**: Switch between Public and Confidential client types
- **Client Secret**: Update or add a client secret (for confidential clients)

**Note:** Changes will be validated against your OIDC provider before being saved. Your existing settings will be preserved if validation fails.

**Security:** For confidential clients, leave the client secret field empty to keep your existing secret unchanged.

data.client_secret: Client Secret (leave empty to keep current)

error.invalid_client_id: Client ID cannot be empty and must contain valid characters.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred. Please check the logs for more details.

init.title: OIDC Authentication Options
init.description:
Update configuration options for your {provider_name} OIDC authentication.

**User Linking:** Control how OIDC users are linked to existing Home Assistant accounts (⚠️ security implications).

**Groups Configuration:** Configure role assignment based on group membership from your identity provider.

**Note:** Changes take effect immediately but may require users to log out and back in.
